articles.title: About this site
articles.description: Some additional details about the website

articles.title: About Me
articles.contents:
Bio
I grew up in New Jersey and completed my undergraduate career in sun-soaked Coral Gables, FL. I graduated from the University of Miami (Go ’Canes!) in May of 2021 with departmental honors and a Bachelor of Science in Psychology with minors in Art and Chemistry. After trekking across the country with my adorable cat, Momo, I am currently working as a post-baccalaureate lab manager at the Biology and Emotion of Addiction Via Experimental and Reproducible Science (BEAVERS) Laboratory, part of the School of Psychological Science at Oregon State University in Corvallis, OR. We examine the complex psychophysiological relationship between addiction, substance use and affect (e.g., anxiety).
In the future, I plan on applying to Clinical Psychology Ph.D. programs in pursuit of reforming the clinical realm and reducing stigma surrounding mental health issues. I am particularly interested in emotional dysregulation, psychotherapy techniques, psychedelic medicine and mindfulness research. I hope to one day be able to combine these interests into research and treatment of addiction, emotional disorders and trauma. In the end, my goals are to help individuals find healing and attenuate the stigma surrounding mental health issues.
As a Latina, queer woman, I am incredibly passionate about diversity, equity and inclusion of all individuals in all spaces. I strive to create safe spaces of acceptance in each of my interactions. I am also an advocate of open science practices – including reproducibility and transparency.
In my free time, I enjoy reading, creating art of many kinds, listening to music, walking in nature, practicing yoga, expressing gratitude and watching documentaries.
Education
B.S. in Psychology | University of Miami | 2021
Interests
Addiction and trauma research
Emotional regulation
Clinical work
Mental health advocacy
Open science
Art creation
Yoga and mindfulness
Expanding my knowledge base
Expressing gratitude
Listening to music
Skills
Trilingual (English, Portuguese, Italian)
R website design
Microsoft Office
Adobe Acrobat, Photoshop and Illustrator
Logo design

            Angelica DeFalco
          
          
            
              Hello and welcome to my personal website!
              I am a post-baccalaureate lab manager for the BEAVERS-Lab at Oregon State University, studying addiction and affect, with the goal of acquiring a Ph.D. in clinical psychology.

articles.title: Momo
articles.contents:
Angelica DeFalco, B.S.
      
      
      About Me
      CV
      
      
      ACADEMIC PORTFOLIO
       
      ▾
      
      
      Figures
      Logos
      Posters
      
      
      ☰
      
      
      
        
          Momo
          
            
        

        
          
      
      
        
          
          Bio
          I’m a calico cat, originally born in Delray Beach, FL but have traveled all the way across the country to Corvallis, OR. I followed this cat to this house one day and next thing you know, I had food, a home and so much love!
          I was named after the lemur from Avatar: The Last Airbender, one of my human’s favorite TV shows. She says I look like him because of my big eyes and ears, but I don’t really see it.
          I like to sleep during the day and wake my human up at 3am with the zoomies. I’m an energetic and curious lil gal who also loves cuddles, sleeping, licks and human food :)
          
          
          Interests
          Purring
          Cuddles
          Human food
          Strings, teaser toys, and wires
          Lasers
          Playing fetch
          Sleeping
          Distill is a publication format for scientific and technical writing, native to the web.
